amarant.title: The rapidly growing popularity is due to the special chemical composition of the plant

phytosterols.title: Phytosterols
phytosterols.description: Amaranth contains phytosterols that actively remove free radicals, cholesterol, and tocopherol, which significantly affects the overall physical and emotional health of a person.

vitamins.title: Vitamins
vitamins.description: The active composition of amaranth includes vitamin D, retinol, potassium, magnesium, and sodium, as well as a huge list of beneficial trace elements that activate the body's metabolic processes, leading to cell regeneration.

protein.title: Protein
protein.description: Amaranth is enriched with protein and lysine, which are characterized by usefulness and nutrition for body cells, and protein from amaranth is absorbed by the body many times better than even dairy proteins.

squalene.title: Squalene
squalene.description: Also an element - squalene, which, penetrating the human body, saturates cells with oxygen, increases their immune protection, which makes the body stronger, more resilient, more enduring and longer-lasting.

ecology.title: Environmental Friendliness
ecology.description: Equipment with minimal power consumption, without emissions into the environment. We aim to transition to work from "green" energy (sun, wind).

development.title: Development

stats.northAmerica: North America: USA, dominant market, more than 30% of total volume. Canada less than 15%, but significant growth expected.

stats.asia: Asia: China: largest market in Asia, about 8%. Japan about 4%. India about 3%. ASEAN about 3%. Australia: about 2%. Other Asian countries: about 0.2%
stats.middleEastAndAfrica: Middle East and Africa: Saudi Arabia: about 1%. United Arab Emirates: about 0.5%. Israel: about 0.5%. South Africa: about 0.5%. Other Middle East and African countries: about 2%
